author: eliasaires
title: Improved Staking & ADA derivatives
description: Low active stake pools provide ~30% fewer yields to delegators than those with a higher active stake, making the barrier of entry for new SPOs insurmountable and consequently centralizing the network.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal identifies a critical problem to the decentralization of Cardano. It has included graphics and explained in a simple manner the current state of stake pools: a small minority of stake pools hold the majority of delegated ADA. More information is included in the whitepaper draft and recommended reading to understand the project further.

The proposal is for funding research on a DeFi protocol that gives users derivatives(sADA) in exchange of ADA that is staked for them. 

Since it is research on the feasibility of an idea, I don't know if this proposal rightly addresses the Challenge, even if the problem highlighted is right on the money. Say, worst case scenario, the proposer learns after crunching the numbers in the first 8 hours that the idea is not feasible(a risk the proposer acknowledges.) What happens to the fund? It seems unreasonable for the proposer to be paid in full for an unfeasible idea. For auditability purposes, this proposal could include a milestone schedule for payment.
f6_assessments.q1:
The whitepaper draft goes into more details on the proposed solution. The roadmap is included and it is fairly clear: research on stake pool mechanisms, calculating profitability, compiling it all on a paper, then sharing it with SPOs for feedback. Then publish it and inquire developers on whether the idea is technically possible.

The proposal would be strengthened if the proposer includes his experience in the disciplines involved; calculating profitability, understanding technical details, researching etc. There are some questions that arise, like what if it's not profitable? Will the researcher stop working on the paper and stop receiving funds? A fully composable derivative earning both staking yield and DeFi yield would be useful as it could be a lego piece used by other protocols. Would this paper include useful information on this even if staking yield is not profitable?(as in, sADA staking yield is lower than staking ADA; but the total yield from lending sADA is higher than just lending ADA.)

I think adding more details on the proposer's ability to deliver a detailed, useful whitepaper would increase enthusiasm for the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer raises a valid issue regarding the distribution of staking between low and high active stake SPO's. Stakeholders will naturally pick the highest ROI to maximize profit but in return will make a certain SPO saturated thus causing an effect of centralization. This initiative might help remedy the problem by distributing ADA evenly to low active SPO thus maintaining decentralization. One major concern of the protocol is security. Can the protocol guarantee the depositors assets can be claimable with ADA on 1 to 1 basis. I urge the proposer to consider every point of vulnerability in their research paper. ADA holders were free to move their coins in the wallet, therefore it is a risky proposition to sacrifice the total control of holding ADA and handing it over to the protocol. Overall, this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem is obvious. Smaller stake pools get less stake because the fixed fee takes a bigger part of the rewards. Their solution is to swap the normal ADA to sADA and they would allocate the normal ADA to stake pool and give the return back to the sADA holder. This would give constant staking yields and the option for double yields. 
Therefore it matches the Challenge criteria, would in theory make Cardano more efficient. 
But there are some problems with this theory. First you would swap your “voting rights” to tokens which represent them. Therefore the protocol/ smart contract or Steak protocol would be able to delegate with your rights. That’s very dangerous. For example if 51% of Cardano is swapped to sADA the protocol would be able to manipulate Cardano. And even if they don´t use this power, they could be hacked. So this could lead to a more centralized Cardano. This is sort of the case with staked ETH. A big part of staked ETH is swapped at the Lido protocol and has led to a more centralized currency. Also doubleyield is possible on current exchanges (like your example Wingriders). This reduces the usefulness. 
In conclusion I think the idea matches the challenge but there are big problems that lower the potential impact. Because of this I give 3 stars because I can´t agree nor disagree.

f6_assessments.q0:
The Improved Staking and ADA Derivatives project aims to contribute real important way to Cardano community. Their goal Is to make the staking process more decentralized, which will be healthy to Cardano ecosystem. They aim to guarantee the returns for the delegators independently from the pool they stake to. With that they will also help the owners of less popular stake pools as the system proposed will work with fixed returns.
In terms of risks, the team has pointed out the ones I believe are the main risks involved in the process, being the worst-case scenario the situation of not being feasible to execute the project. For such case, even though there would be some important lessons learned that would be shared via publications/papers. A good thing too is that the team is first doing an investigation phase (this proposal) to find out the feasibility of the idea.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has provided a very detailed plan together with the timeline and key milestones well defined. The approach for the phase 1 (research) seems reasonable and well structured, and in the end the team should be able to indicate the feasibility or not for the improved staking they are proposing.
The budget breakdown also sounds adequate for this phase of the project they are proposing to.
Finally, Mr. Elias Aires seems to have the necessary experience to perform the research comprised by the phase 1 of the project, and he is proposing to consult some experts in order to get feedback about his finds which is also good. Way to go.
f6_assessments.q2: From auditability perspective the project of improved staking and ADA derivatives was also well thought, having the team settled some indicators to be tracked in order to audit the evolution of the project, being them: number of SPOs consulted, number of developers consulted and peer review. With these initiatives the team will be able to measure the success of the project as well as correct the path in time to make things work properly. I have no further suggestions on auditability for this project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is about researching a solution to improve the net staking rewards for users to increase new users and stake pools to contribute more to the community. As I understand it, the (theoretically) solution mentioned by the proponent is basically to create an intermediary protocol called sADA so that users can exchange their ADA for sADA (a token). These sADAs will link (representative) the user's SPO to other stake pools. More specifically, it acts as an intermediary protocol that receives ADA from the user and transfers it to the wallet requested by the user. Then send staking keys to stake pools. And stake pools move rewards back there. Finally, the reward is given back to the user. The goal of this is via this protocol, stake pool fees will be ensured to be consistent, and decentralized for SPO rewards. For me, this idea fits the challenge of Dapp's innovation, and the proponent did a great job presenting his solution.

Overall, the proposal is still incomplete. I love when the proposer provides diagrams to analyze, and explain the function, and how the protocol works very clearly. However, the explanation of the protocol is quite complicated so proposers should provide more examples with case studies to make this part easier to understand. The proposal has clearly outlined the benefits that users will get when using the protocol. In addition, the proposer should explain more about the technology and how to implement the protocol.

It can be seen that the proposer is quite aligned with the challenge. But the proposal should describe more clearly what the outcome of the project after marketing communication will be. And, the proposer should put specific KPI indicators to prove that this proposal will make Cardano expand and develop more.

As for the risks, the proposal has raised and explained the risks, but the solution is still incomplete and detailed. The proposer should have a clear action plan for what to do when risks occur.
